name: Qatar Personal Data Privacy Law
description: Qatar Personal Data Privacy Law 13/2016 compliance framework for data protection and AI governance.

framework.name: Qatar Personal Data Privacy Law
framework.description: Framework for compliance with Qatar's Personal Data Privacy Law 13/2016 and national AI policy requirements

structure.title: Chapter 1: General Provisions
structure.description: Definitions, scope, and applicability of the law

items.title: Article 1 - Definitions
items.description: Key definitions including personal data, data controller, data processor, and consent
items.summary: Establish clear definitions for data protection terms
questions: Are all personal data types identified?

items.title: Article 2 - Scope of Application
items.description: The law applies to processing of personal data within Qatar and by Qatar-based entities

structure.title: Chapter 2: Data Processing Principles
structure.description: Core principles governing the processing of personal data

items.title: Article 3 - Lawfulness and Fairness
items.description: Personal data must be processed lawfully, fairly, and transparently
items.summary: Ensure lawful and fair data processing
questions: Is lawful basis documented for each processing activity?
Are data subjects informed of processing?

items.title: Article 4 - Purpose Limitation
items.description: Personal data must be collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes
items.summary: Limit data processing to specified purposes
questions: Is secondary use of data controlled?
Are purposes communicated to data subjects?

items.title: Article 5 - Data Minimization
items.description: Personal data collected must be adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary
items.summary: Minimize data collection to necessary scope
questions: Is data collection limited to necessity?

items.title: Article 6 - Accuracy
items.description: Personal data must be accurate and kept up to date
questions: Are data accuracy procedures in place?
Can data subjects update their data?

items.title: Article 7 - Storage Limitation
items.description: Personal data must not be kept longer than necessary
items.summary: Limit data retention to necessary period
questions: Is data deleted when no longer needed?

items.title: Article 8 - Security
items.description: Personal data must be processed with appropriate security measures

structure.title: Chapter 3: Data Subject Rights
structure.description: Rights granted to individuals regarding their personal data

items.title: Article 9 - Right to Information
items.description: Data subjects have the right to be informed about processing of their data
items.summary: Provide transparent information to data subjects

items.title: Article 10 - Right of Access
items.description: Data subjects have the right to access their personal data
questions: Is data provided in accessible format?

items.title: Article 11 - Right to Rectification
items.description: Data subjects have the right to correct inaccurate data
questions: Are third parties notified of corrections?

items.title: Article 12 - Right to Erasure
items.description: Data subjects have the right to request deletion of their data
questions: Is data actually deleted from all systems?

items.title: Article 13 - Right to Object
items.description: Data subjects have the right to object to processing
questions: Can data subjects object to processing?
Is processing stopped when objection is valid?

structure.title: Chapter 4: Cross-Border Transfers
structure.description: Requirements for transferring personal data outside Qatar

items.title: Article 14 - Transfer Restrictions
items.description: Personal data may only be transferred outside Qatar with regulatory approval

items.title: Article 15 - Adequacy Determinations
items.description: Transfers allowed to countries with adequate protection levels

items.title: Article 16 - Standard Contractual Clauses
items.description: Use of approved contractual clauses for international transfers

structure.title: Chapter 5: AI and Automated Processing
structure.description: Requirements for AI systems and automated decision-making under national AI policy

items.title: Article 17 - QCB FinTech Sandbox Compliance
items.description: AI systems in financial services must comply with QCB FinTech sandbox guidelines
items.summary: Ensure AI compliance in financial services
questions: Is AI system registered with QCB sandbox?

items.title: Article 18 - Automated Decision Rights
items.description: Data subjects have rights regarding automated decision-making
questions: Can data subjects request human review?

items.title: Article 19 - AI Transparency
items.description: AI systems must be transparent and explainable
questions: Are data subjects informed of AI use?

items.title: Article 20 - AI Risk Assessment
items.description: AI systems must undergo risk assessment before deployment

items.title: Article 21 - Regulatory Authority
items.description: The regulatory authority oversees compliance and enforcement

items.title: Article 22 - Breach Notification
items.description: Data breaches must be notified to the regulator and affected individuals
questions: Is breach detection capability in place?

items.title: Article 23 - Penalties
items.description: Violations may result in fines and other penalties
questions: Is legal counsel engaged for compliance?
